para: The duplicate filter removes duplicate waypoints from your data. You can define a "duplicate" based on a waypoint's short name, its geographic location, or both.
By default, the filter keeps the first occurrence of a waypoint and removes all subsequent duplicates. This behavior can be modified with the available options.
You must specify at least one of shortname or location to define how duplicates are identified.

The filter's behavior can be modified with these options:
shortname: Identifies duplicates based on matching waypoint short names.
location: Identifies duplicates based on matching geographic coordinates.
all: Deletes all instances of a duplicated item, including the original.
correct: Keeps the original waypoint's information but updates its coordinates with those from a subsequent duplicate.
